alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 4:06AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of McDonald County through 500 AM CDT... At 406 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South West City, or 9 miles northeast of Jay, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Sugar Creek State Park, Anderson, Noel, Dodge, Goodman, South West City, Pineville, Lanagan, Cayuga, Tiff City and Rocky Comfort. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southwestern Missouri.
